title: TexturePacker wrong Y value
body:
#### Issue details
After this commit: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/08cd7fd9768ff487ef69fd7611c239831312359d legacy format of TexturePacker produces wrong values for the Y position in the `.atlas` file.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Pack some images with libGDX `1.10.0` and pack the same images with `1.10.1-SNAPSHOT`, Y values in the atlas file are wrong and doesn't match the pixels position in the final PNG.
This is the correct texture rendering using an Atlas made with TexturePacker prior 08cd7fd9768ff487ef69fd7611c239831312359d:
![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5543339/142701611-713b8265-4d2b-4e96-8978-fe2fbf344300.png)

This is the same scene with same textures but after this commit 08cd7fd9768ff487ef69fd7611c239831312359d:
![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5543339/142701566-c1e3c6a2-fa2f-4ffd-ac19-1071e1f0c742.png)

As you can see atlas is not correctly cut because Y values are wrong and few pixels of the edge are picked from the next image in the atlas, like the ground has the white edge of another texture:
![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5543339/142701845-74b75358-a982-447c-9518-ad2af15115ea.png)


#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] macOS
